body.p:
Augusta Ky April 28th 1864
Govr Bramlette. My Dear Sir;

I have not thought it proper in me to ask personal favors of your excellency. nor would I now do so, did I not feel it was my duty -- Benjiman F. Nelson of Company D. 16th Ky vol. Inft -- and Joseph McCollum same regiment company E, have so gallantly behaved on the field, and in Camp, that I do sincerely hope you may find it in Your power to advance them to a Lt -- Both these young are , sober -- obedient, Sprightly & true soldiers, in any regard worthy of Govr Bramlettes consideration & promotion --

Deeply impresssed with the appeal I am making to the Governor. I assure You that neither of these young men are in anywise akin to me, but are worthy -- poor -- honest and
appreciative soldiers
Your Kindnesss to them will fill with gratitude the heart of noble loyal fathers, & ever be remembered by me with more than thanks
I would be proud to enclose there Commisssions

Truly Yours
Obt. Srt
Jos Doniphan
To the Governor recommending to his favorable consideration for promotion Benj F. Nelson of Co "D" 16th Ky and Joseph McCullum of Co E" same Regt.

L B No 3 -- 1864 P. 185
Recd A G. O. 3d May 1864
